a.title: Return to the homepage on the district site.

div.p: Online Learning, Resources and COVID 19 Information

span.strong: Click an Icon to Link to Information

span.p: Dear KSD Families and Staff Members,

In an effort to help prevent the spread of COVID 19, all school buildings are closed. Online education will continue through the end of the school year. To streamline communication, we developed this website to ensure clear and consistent information is provided to all families.

To assist families at this time, a Tech Chat is available from 8 am to 4 pm on weekdays. A phone hotline is also available 314.213.6121 from 8 am to 4 pm on weekdays. Thank you for your patience, understanding, and partnership as we continue to work through thischallenging situation.

div.h1: Upcoming Virtual Events-. Click on the date and title, and you will be directed to more information.

div.p: There are no upcoming events to display.

p.span: It is with a heavy heart that we announce that our students and staff will not return to school buildings for the remainder of the 2019-20 school year. This decision, while very difficult, was made in conjunction with guidance from local health and government officials. We will continue to follow their guidance as we make decisions on end of year events, keeping the best interest of the health and safety of our students, staff, and communities as our priority.

Knowing that our connection with our families is crucial right now, we plan to continue to support our students and school community. This support includes the continuation of online learning, the provision of social-emotional and wellness supports and grab and go meals.

I recognize that this news impacts each of us differently, and I'm sure there are and will be many questions. I do not want to overwhelm you with details at this time, but please look for additional information in the coming days, from your school principal and through our KSD eSpotlight.
Please know that we are here for you and will continue to provide the compassion and consistency our students need at this time. We will continue to improve and add
resources as we navigate these unchartered waters together.

h1.aria-label: As of Monday, April 6 - All Grab & Go Meals at Nipher
h1.span: As of Monday, April 6 - All Grab & Go Meals at Nipher

div.p: As of Monday, Apirl 6, Grab and Go Meals will be provided at Nipher Middle School, 700 S. Kirkwood Road, from 11am to 1pm. Families can sign up for meals via an online form.

COVID 19 is now identified as community spread in the St. Louis area, which means the CDC will not contact the school district when there is a new case. Any information we have has been shared directly with us by the person or family of someone with a positive COVID 19 diagnosis.

The District is aware of positive cases within the school community since the closure of school. These confirmed positives occurred at least 14 days after the school closure on March 13. The Missouri Department of Health and Senior Services (DHSS) and the St. Louis County Department of Public Health is handling all direct communication with anyone who has come into contact with a person who has tested positive for COVID 19.

Be assured that the Kirkwood School District will continue to take every precaution to ensure the health and safety of our entire school community. Please remember the school grounds, parking lots, playgrounds and tracks and fields are closed to the public. More information about this is included under the prevention tab on this website.

The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) and the Missouri DHSS have advised that all persons who experience symptoms of COVID-19 should contact their health care providers. Individuals may also reach out to the St. Louis County Department of Public Health (314-615-0600, after hours) or the Missouri DHSS (877-435-8411, open 24/7).

Once again, COVID 19 is now identified as community spread in the St. Louis area, which means health officials will not contact the school district when there is a new case. Any information we have has been shared directly with us by the person or family of someone with a positive COVID 19 diagnosis. As we continue to see more cases identified, we will not be able to verify and send notifications.

h1.aria-label: School Property - Inside and Outside Closed - Stay Home & Be Safe
h1.span: School Property - Inside and Outside Closed - Stay Home & Be Safe

p.span: Kirkwood School District playgrounds, fields, tracks, and other outdoor areas are closed during the St. Louis County stay at home order. These spaces are off-limits to reduce the spread of the coronavirus.
According to medical experts, the coronavirus can live on surfaces for days.

People can catch COVID-19 by touching contaminated surfaces or objects and then touching their eyes, nose or mouth. This makes public spaces a high contamination area. Playgrounds are especially susceptible as they are considered high-touch facilities. Also, it isnt advisable to hold large gatherings on school parking lots or use a basketball or anything where multiple people are using the same equipment.

We understand the need to get out and walk or run, please practice social distancing at all times. In the best interest of our school community, please stay off all public spaces. Thank you for your cooperation, patience, and understanding during this time.

div.p: March 23, 2020 at 4:15 pm.
KSD School Community:

To remain consistent with the St. Louis County Stay at Home Orders, guidance from local health and government officials, and in the best interest of the health and safety of our students, staff, and communities all St. Louis Public and City public schools will remain closed through Wednesday, April 22.

h1.aria-label: 3.21.2020: KSD School Playgrounds and KHS Stadium Closed
h1.span: 3.21.2020: KSD School Playgrounds and KHS Stadium Closed

div.p: During the school closure, we recognize that there are many ways for families to enjoy the outdoors to relieve stress.
We are following health and safety guidelines and closing all playgrounds and E.L. Lyons Memorial Stadium until further notice. We urge everyone to practice social distancing while outdoors.
For more information about preventing the spread of Covid-19, please see the CDCs guidelines atcdc.gov.

h1.aria-label: 3.21.2020: Updated Guidelines from St. Louis County Executive
h1.span: 3.21.2020: Updated Guidelines from St. Louis County Executive

p.strong: Important Notice - ExecutiveStay at Home OrderIssued for St. Louis County

div.p: Today, St. Louis County Executive Same Page announced that they plan to implement mandatory stay-at-home orders starting Monday, March 23, 2020. Based on the order, we are moving the date to pick up essential items and devices to Sunday, March 22. Building principals will send an update to anyone who requested to pick up devices at school. Staff will also receive an updated schedule.
Thank you for your continued patience as we continue to meet the needs of our students and staff while following guidelines set forth by our government officials and health professionals.
Thank you,

Ginger Cayce
Chief Communications Officer

There will be no Paper administration for Advanced Placement (AP) tests this year. Students will be able to access the 45-minute exams during one of two scheduled times. All exams will be modified to cover only the first 75% of the content due to school closures.

Students will be able to access AP Classroom, the online tutorial for academic support.
These exams will be available on Laptops and all mobile devices.
All educators, AP coordinators, administrators and students will receive extensive information from the College Board.

p.span: Statewide assessments have been canceled for the remainder of the SY 2019-20 school year.
School districts will not be required to make up SY 2019-20 calendar hours lost due to COVID-19 and missed calendar hours will not impact the calculation of average daily attendance.

span.noscript: Chat with us, powered by LiveChat

ul.li: Blackboard Web Community Manager Privacy Policy (Updated) |
